question: Chapare virus, which has been found to spread via human-to-human transmission, was observed in which country?
explanation:
As per the researchers from the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), the Chapare virus is found to have human-to-human transmission.
The biggest outbreak of the virus was reported in 2019 and caused three deaths. The Chapare haemorrhagic fever (CHHF) is caused by the same arenavirus family, which is responsible for Ebola virus disease. It is named after the region in which it was first observed.
